page.title: 02STRAWBERRY HILL BR STATION
page.content: Strawberry Hill Station is just over 100 years old. It was built in 1882 and rebuilt about 40 years ago. It is a branch line making a loop between Twickenham and New Malden. The station has two platforms. Opposite the ticket office is the oldest part of the station which used to be the station managers house, but is now rented out.The station has just been repainted and the track is changed every 10-12 years. The station handles roughly 3-4000 passengers a day, with 56 drivers based at the depot near by. During the rush hour thre are 4 trains an hour, at non-rush hour and weekends there are two trains an hour. The timetable is changed every May . The crossing gates wre changed 10 years ago and are controlled from Feltham using close circuit T.V. ARCHDEACON CAMBRIDGE SCHOOL.
